0.title: Venezuela’s Ex-Spy Chief Rejects Maduro, Accusing Leader’s Inner Circle of Corruption
0.description: Hugo Carvajal, left, with President Nicolás Maduro in Caracas, Venezuela, in 2014. In a statement Thursday, the former intelligence chief urged the military to turn against Mr. Maduro.

1.title: Venezuela Blocks Highway to Stop Aid Shipment Organized by Opposition
1.description: The attempt to deliver desperately needed supplies is a test of strength for both President Nicolás Maduro and his opponents.

2.title: U.S. Issues New Penalties Against Venezuelan Officials, Vowing ‘Maduro Must Go’
2.description: A State Department envoy said military intervention in Venezuela would be a distant line of action behind other efforts to apply diplomatic and economic pressure.

3.title: Scenes from Venezuela: Violence Erupts at Border
3.description: Venezuelan security forces and protesters faced off in the border town of Ureña as locals tried to clear a path for humanitarian aid to enter the country from Colombia. Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and the opposition leader Juan Guaidó are in a standof…

4.title: Maduro Is Denying Venezuelans U.S. Aid. His Opposition Sees an Opportunity.
4.description: President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela has sent troops to the Colombian border to block U.S. humanitarian aid from entering his country. We go to the town of Cúcuta, where the aid impasse is building toward a confrontation.

5.title: Desertions Reflect Discontent With Maduro, but Not Enough to Topple Him
5.description: The opposition pushed the armed forces to chose between loyalty to Maduro and aid for Venezuela. A few have broken with the government — and more are doing so each day.

6.title: Venezuela’s Hunger Games
6.description: President Maduro, clinging desperately to power, uses humanitarian aid as a weapon against his own people.

7.title: Felipe González: We Must Not Fail the Venezuelan People
7.description: To restore democracy in the Latin American nation, foreign powers need to step aside and let the regional stakeholders resolve the crisis.

8.title: Turn in Venezuela Crisis Hinges on Aid Showdown at Border
8.description: Colombian security forces stand guard in front of shipping containers placed by Venezuelan security forces to block the border bridge that connects Colombia to Venezuela.

9.title: The Battle at the Venezuelan Border
9.description: BURNED OFFERINGS Venezuelan officials blocked the border with Colombia in a bid to keep out humanitarian supplies. On Saturday, opposition supporters salvaged goods from a truck set on fire in a clash on a border bridge.

10.title: Venezuela: A Nation Gripped by Hyperinflation
10.description: Shoppers in Guaicaipuro, Venezuela, searched for food at a grocery store where nearly all shelves were empty because of massive food shortages plaguing the country last year.

11.title: Michael Cohen, Donald Trump, Pakistan: Your Wednesday Briefing
11.description: President Trump and President Nguyen Phu Trong of Vietnam in Hanoi today.

12.title: Backup Plan Is Needed to Prevent Venezuelan Famine
12.description: Sanctions on the country’s oil export will further damage a collapsed economy, increasing the risk of starvation.

13.title: U.S. Sanctions Are Aimed at Venezuela’s Oil. Its Citizens May Suffer First.
13.description: Venezuelans waited in line last month to buy hard-to-find butter and pasta. With new American sanctions now in place, one analyst said, “we’re looking at starvation.”

14.title: U.S. Issues New Penalties Against Venezuelan Officials, Vowing ‘Maduro Must Go’
14.description: A State Department envoy said military intervention in Venezuela would be a distant line of action behind other efforts to apply diplomatic and economic pressure.

15.title: Venezuela, India, North Korea: Your Monday Briefing
15.description: Venezuela’s opposition leader, Juan Guaidó, waving to supporters in Colombia last month.

16.title: Jorge Ramos: The Dictator of Venezuela Earns His Title
16.description: Nicolás Maduro stole my television crew’s cameras and expelled me from the country, all because he was afraid of an interview.

17.title: Venezuela Closes Border to 3 Caribbean Islands Ahead of Aid Showdown
17.description: The move against Aruba, Bonaire and Curaçao came before a Saturday deadline by the Venezuelan opposition and the Trump administration for President Nicolás Maduro to end a blockade.

18.title: Pence, in Colombia to Meet Guaidó, Announces New Venezuela Sanctions
18.description: While relatively modest, the actions represented a ratcheting up of the American effort to oust President Nicolás Maduro, and Vice President Mike Pence warned of more punitive steps to come.

19.title: Juan Guaidó, Facing Arrest Threat, Returns to Venezuela
19.description: The Venezuelan opposition leader, Juan Guaidó, with Ecuador’s president, Lenín Moreno, in Salinas, Ecuador, last week.

20.title: Juan Guaidó, Facing Arrest Threat, Returns to Venezuela
20.description: The Venezuelan opposition leader, Juan Guaidó, at the Simon Bolívar International airport near Caracas, on Monday.

21.title: How to Tackle Venezuela’s Military Problem
21.description: Venezuelan soldiers and militia members were filmed by the state last month to show their strength and their support for President Nicolás Maduro.

22.title: Deadly Violence Erupts on Brazil Border in Venezuela Aid Showdown
22.description: Venezuela’s political showdown escalated on Friday as security forces fired on those protesting the government’s determination to block aid.

23.title: Deadly Violence Erupts on Brazil Border in Venezuela Aid Showdown
23.description: Venezuela’s political showdown escalated on Friday as security forces fired on those protesting the government’s determination to block aid.

24.title: The Sanders Foreign Policy Advantage
24.description: He has put forward a comprehensive vision that pits democratic peoples everywhere against illiberalism at home and abroad.

25.title: Venezuela crisis: Maduro condemns 'extremist' Trump
25.description: Venezuela's embattled president tells the BBC the offer of aid is an intervention plan by the US.

26.title: Venezuela crisis: Juan Guaidó to return after tour
26.description: Self-declared interim president Juan Guaidó calls for mass protests as he returns to Venezuela.

27.title: Venezuela crisis: Guaidó calls for support amid deadly border clashes
27.description: Amid bloody violence, the Venezuelan opposition leader asks other nations to consider "all measures".

28.title: Venezuela to expel German ambassador for 'meddling'
28.description: Daniel Kriener is one of the ambassadors who received opposition leader Juan Guaidó at the airport.

29.title: Venezuela crisis: Rival border concerts as aid row continues
29.description: The events near the border with Colombia are held as a row over humanitarian aid continues.

30.title: The key points Trump is expected to make
30.description: President Trump is giving a speech at Florida International University about the crisis in Venezuela. Follow here for the latest.

31.title: US aid lands in Colombia as part of effort to deliver supplies to Venezuela
31.description: The US military cargo planes departed from Miami to transport supplies to Colombia as part of the Trump Administration's response to the Venezuela regional crisis.

32.title: Pence will meet with Venezuelan opposition leader in Colombia after violent weekend
32.description: US Vice President Mike Pence will meet with Venezuela's self-declared interim president and opposition leader, Juan Guaido in Bogota, Colombia Monday, following a weekend of violent clashes along Venezuela's borders with Colombia and Brazil.

33.title: Venezuela crisis: Juan Guaidó vows to bring in aid
33.description: He tells a rally that supplies will arrive next week, despite opposition from President Maduro.

34.title: Venezuela aid: Genuine help or Trojan horse?
34.description: The crisis around humanitarian aid has become a political issue, says the BBC's Katy Watson.

35.title: Juan Guaidó flies back to Venezuela amid arrest risk
35.description: Venezuela's self-declared interim leader arrives at Caracas airport, where he risks arrest.

36.title: In pictures: Clashes break out in Venezuela border towns
36.description: There were dramatic scenes as opposition supporters tried to bring in aid against the government's wishes.

37.title: Venezuela crisis: US planes carrying aid arrive in Colombia
37.description: The aid is being stockpiled in Colombia at the request of self-declared interim leader Juan Guaidó.

38.title: Venezuela opposition rallies to tell Maduro: Let aid in
38.description: Venezuela's opposition supporters will take to the streets nationwide on Tuesday to keep up the heat on embattled President Nicolas Maduro and to call on him to let humanitarian aid into the country where food and medicine shortages are rife.

39.title: Venezuela security forces kill, punish anti-Maduro protesters: Amnesty
39.description: Venezuelan security forces have executed several people and arbitrarily detained hundreds of others in a campaign to punish people who protested against President Nicolas Maduro, human rights group Amnesty International said on Wednesday.

40.title: Exclusive: Meeting Maduro - Inside a U.S. businessman's oil deal with Venezuela
40.description: In November 2017, Harry Sargeant III, a wealthy American businessman, flew to Venezuela to see about buying some oil.

41.title: Univision says team held in Venezuela while interviewing president
41.description: Spanish-language U.S. television network Univision said on Monday a news team led by its anchor Jorge Ramos was detained at the presidential palace in Caracas, Venezuela, while interviewing President Nicolas Maduro.

42.title: Russian bid for U.N. action on Venezuela fails
42.description: Russia failed on Thursday in a bid for the United Nations Security Council to adopt a resolution that expressed support for a political solution in Venezuela and backed the Maduro government as the primary coordinator of international help.

43.title: Bolton says Venezuela U.N. military attache backs Guaido
43.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's national security adviser said on Wednesday that Venezuela's U.N. military attache has formally recognized opposition leader Juan Guaido as Venezuela's interim president, increasing pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

44.title: Venezuela, United States still discussing status of U.S. diplomats: minister
44.description: Venezuela and the United States are still in discussions about the status of U.S. diplomats in Caracas ahead of next week's deadline imposed by President Nicolas Maduro for them to leave, Venezuela's foreign minister said on Friday.

45.title: Venezuela's Guaido says he will return home on Monday to lead protests
45.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido said he would return to Venezuela on Monday to lead new protests against President Nicolas Maduro, running the risk that authorities arrest him given he flouted a travel ban to leave the country last week.

46.title: Exclusive: Venezuela's Maduro seeks OPEC help against U.S. sanctions - letter
46.description: Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro has sought OPEC support against U.S. sanctions imposed on his country's oil industry, citing their impact on oil prices and potential risks for other members of the producer group.

47.title: Battle of the bands: Dueling concerts as aid for Venezuelans in limbo
47.description: Tensions along the Colombia-Venezuela border over the entry of aid meant to alleviate widespread food and medicine shortages in the socialist country will be accompanied by music on Friday, as rival concerts kick off on both sides of the boundary.

48.title: Russia tells U.S. it is ready for bilateral talks on Venezuela
48.description: Russia is ready to take part in bilateral talks with the United States over the issue of Venezuela, Russia's foreign minister told his U.S. counterpart late on Saturday.

49.title: Colombia calls at U.N. for action on Venezuela crisis
49.description: Colombia called on Wednesday for action to end Venezuela's humanitarian crisis and bring about a political transition leading to free elections.

50.title: Venezuela's Guaido says 600 military have left Maduro government
50.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido, visiting Paraguay on Friday to raise support for a change of government in his country, said that 600 members of the military have abandoned the government of Nicolas Maduro in recent days.

51.title: Russia and U.S. foreign ministers to discuss Venezuela: Moscow
51.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo will discuss the situation in Venezuela later on Tuesday by phone, Lavrov said.

52.title: U.S. may slap new sanctions on Venezuela if aid convoys blocked: official
52.description: The U.S. government could announce new sanctions to pressure Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro as early as next week unless his military defies orders to block convoys of humanitarian aid planned for this weekend, a senior administration official said on Fr…

53.title: Maduro and Trump should meet to 'find common ground': Venezuela minister
53.description: Venezuela's foreign minister said on Wednesday that the United States was trying to overthrow the government of Nicolas Maduro and that his country had lost $30 billion in assets "confiscated" since Nov. 2017, including from the state oil company Citgo.

54.title: Venezuela opposition must pass over 'our dead bodies' to oust Maduro: minister
54.description: Venezuelan Defense Minister Vladimir Padrino said on Tuesday the country's opposition would have to pass over "our dead bodies" to oust President Nicolas Maduro and impose a new government.

55.title: With border blocked, desperate Venezuelans ask how U.S. aid will arrive
55.description: Desperate Venezuelans asked on Wednesday how they would gain access to U.S. food and medicine aid due to arrive via the Colombia border after President Nicolas Maduro's government blocked the frontier crossing to any humanitarian shipments.

56.title: U.S. derides Venezuela's accusation of lacing aid with poison
56.description: The United States scoffed on Friday at Venezuela's accusation that it was poisoning humanitarian aid, and urged allies to stop the "decrepit, dictatorial regime" of President Nicolas Maduro from chairing U.N. arms talks.

57.title: EU-backed group warns against chaos in Venezuela as aid trucks arrive
57.description: European and Latin American leaders called for dialogue and elections to solve a deepening crisis in Venezuela on Thursday, warning against rash intervention in the country even as trucks bringing humanitarian aid lined up near the border.

58.title: Venezuela's Guaido to visit Brazil in bid to keep pressure on Maduro
58.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido was to arrive in Brazil on Wednesday night to meet with Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro as part of a tour of several nations to drum up international pressure on President Nicolas Maduro to step down.

59.title: Venezuelan troops fire tear gas at Colombian border: witness
59.description: Venezuelan troops near the Colombian border on Saturday fired tear gas at a group of people seeking to cross into the neighboring nation to work, according to a Reuters witness.

60.title: Aid convoy leaves Colombian warehouses for Venezuela border: opposition leader
60.description: A convoy of trucks carrying humanitarian aid for Venezuela left warehouses in Colombia headed for the nearby border crossing on Saturday, despite Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's insistence they would not be allowed to cross.

61.title: Russia accuses U.S. of planning to arm the opposition in Venezuela
61.description: Russia's Ministry of Foreign Affairs on Friday accused the United States and its NATO allies of discussing how to arm the opposition in Venezuela and alleged Washington was deploying special forces and equipment near the South American nation.

62.title: U.S. to deliver over 200 tons of aid to Venezuelan border
62.description: U.S. military aircraft are expected to deliver more than 200 tons of humanitarian aid to the Venezuelan border in Colombia, with the shipment likely to take place on Saturday, a U.S. official said on Friday.

63.title: Eleven Venezuela diplomats in U.S. defect from Maduro since last month: official
63.description: Eleven Venezuelan diplomats in the United States have defected from President Nicolas Maduro's government since opposition leader Juan Guaido declared himself interim president last month, a representative of Venezuela's opposition said on Thursday.

64.title: U.S. raises pressure on Maduro via sanctions, aid airlift
64.description: The United States ratcheted up pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro on Friday by sanctioning some of his top security officials and the head of the state oil company, and unveiling plans to airlift over 200 tons of aid to the Colombian border.

65.title: Venezuelan troops kill one in first bloodshed linked to aid entry
65.description: Venezuelan troops killed at least one person and wounded several others on Friday near the Brazilian border, witnesses said, the first bloodshed linked to opposition efforts to bring aid into the South American country against the wishes of embattled Presiden…

66.title: Indigenous Pemon on Venezuela's border with Brazil vow to let aid in
66.description: Venezuela's Pemon, an indigenous people living along the border with Brazil, are determined to allow into the embattled country any foreign aid that may arrive, even if that means a showdown with Venezuelan security forces and the government of President Nico…

67.title: Cuba charges U.S. moving special forces, preparing Venezuelan intervention
67.description: Cuba charged on Thursday that the United States was secretly moving special forces closer to Venezuela as part of a plan to intervene in the South American country using the pretext of a humanitarian crisis.

68.title: How Venezuela turns its useless bank notes into gold
68.description: EL CALLAO, Venezuela (REUTERS) - Venezuela's most successful financial operations in recent years have not taken place on Wall Street, but in primitive gold-mining camps in the nation's southern reaches.

69.title: Total says accounts blocked, evacuating staff from Venezuela
69.description: French oil group Total has evacuated its remaining staff from Venezuela and its bank accounts there have been blocked as a result of U.S. sanctions, the company's chief executive said on Thursday.

70.title: Venezuela's Guaido begins journey home from Ecuador
70.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido left on Sunday from the Ecuadorian coastal town of Salinas after announcing his intention to return home to lead new protests against President Nicolas Maduro, though his route back remains unknown.

71.title: Pink Floyd's Waters slams Venezuela border aid concert
71.description: Pink Floyd co-founder Roger Waters slammed an upcoming "Live Aid"-style concert to raise funds for humanitarian aid for Venezuela, calling the event a U.S.-backed effort to tarnish the socialist government in a video circulating on Tuesday.

72.title: Senators propose bill to let thousands of Venezuelans remain in U.S.
72.description: Republican and Democratic U.S. senators proposed legislation on Thursday that would let an estimated 72,000 Venezuelans remain in the United States after fleeing chaos in their country.

73.title: Trump policies unite allies against him at European security forum
73.description: In 2009, then U.S. Vice President Joe Biden came to Munich to "press the reset button" with Russia. A decade later he came again to offer the world better relations, this time with his own country.

74.title: Trump policies unite allies against him at European security forum
74.description: In 2009, then U.S. Vice President Joe Biden came to Munich to "press the reset button" with Russia. A decade later he came again to offer the world better relations, this time with his own country.

75.title: One witness, conflicting evidence: How Venezuelan justice targets the opposition
75.description: Local opposition leader Jose Rengel has spent almost five weeks in a cramped detention cell on the outskirts of the Venezuelan capital Caracas, after a single witness accused him of leading a riot that burned down a public building.

76.title: Spain would 'roundly condemn' use of force in Venezuela
76.description: Spanish foreign minister says Madrid would not support military action to oust Nicolás Maduro Spain has warned that it will not back any military intervention in Venezuela after the South American country’s opposition leader, Juan Guaidó, urged other nations …

77.title: Venezuela: Nicolás Maduro’s demise is ‘irreversible’, Trump adviser says
77.description: Top Latin America adviser claims ‘there is not a single scenario’ in which Maduro and his ‘cronies’ are able to retain power Donald Trump’s top Latin America adviser has claimed “there is not a single scenario” in which Nicolás Maduro and his “cronies” are ab…

78.title: Infant mortality in Venezuela has doubled during crisis, UN says
78.description: UN security council officials clash over ‘politicised’ aid to troubled country as peace-building chief warns of ‘grim realities’ Infant mortality in Venezuela has soared by roughly 50% during the prolonged political crisis in the country. Briefing the UN secu…

79.title: Trump seeks to rally US-based Venezuelans against Nicolás Maduro
79.description: President to speak at Florida International University in Miami White House previews appeal to Venezuela military Donald Trump will speak on Monday in the largest Venezuelan community in the US, seeking to rally support for the opposition leader, Juan Guaidó,…

80.title: Venezuelan opposition plans delivery of aid
80.description: Guaidó calls for volunteers to carry stockpiled US aid over the border on Saturday Members of Venezuela’s opposition are gathering in Cúcuta, Colombia, where they are frantically planning to shift stockpiled US aid to their homeland this weekend, in defiance …

81.title: Panama Papers ‘tightened the noose’ on offshore assets of Maduro’s inner circle
81.description: In the wake of the scandal, it became harder to launder money through investment in Panamanian real estate for Venezuelans who grew rich on the back of their political connections On Avenida Balboa, Panama City’s premier seafront avenue, the 50 story tower bl…

82.title: Pence On Venezuela: 'We Will Keep Standing Until Your Libertad Is Restored'
82.description: "The struggle in Venezuela is between dictatorship and democracy," U.S. Vice President Pence said in Colombia. He was there to support Juan Guaidó, who has declared himself Venezuela's interim leader.

83.title: Trump's Venezuela Moves Follow Long History Of Intervention In Latin America
83.description: History suggests that if the U.S. takes too large a role in the South American country's crisis, experts and former diplomats warn, it could spark a worse backlash than the original issue.

84.title: Venezuela's Government Appears To be Trying To Hack Activists With Phishing Pages
84.description: Hackers allegedly working for the embattled Venezuelan government tried to trick activists into giving away their passwords to popular services such as Gmail, Facebook, Twitter, and others, according to security researchers. From a report: Last week, the Vene…

85.title: As Venezuela descends into chaos, Marco Rubio posts bloody tweet and highlights alleged poisoning of opposition lawmaker
85.description: Senator Marco Rubio (R) has continued to advocate for Venezuelan opposition amid a deepening crisis, amplifying reports of protests and alleged human rights abuses, and posting aggressive tweets. Rubio has been a longtime supporter of the Venezuelan oppositio…

86.title: The Bank of England has frozen $1.56 billion of Venezuela's gold reserves as regime debate escalates
86.description: The Bank of England has reportedly frozen £1.2 billion ($1.56 billion) of the gold reserves it holds for the Venezuelan regime just days after the UK and other European leaders recognised Juan Gaudió as the country's leader. Venezuela has been crippled by hig…

87.title: Rep. Ilhan Omar had a heated exchange with Trump's Venezuela envoy over his role in the US's violent history in Central America
87.description: Democratic Rep. Ilhan Omar on Wednesday had a heated exchange with the Trump administration's envoy to Venezuela over his record in Latin America. The Minnesota congresswoman pressed Elliot Abrams on his conviction in the Iran-Contra affair and role in downpl…

88.title: Bernie Sanders slams Trump for sticking by Saudi Arabia, but applauds his dialogue with Kim Jong Un
88.description: Sen. Bernie Sanders gave President Donald Trump mixed reviews on foreign policy during a CNN town hall focused on his 2020 presidential campaign on Monday. Sanders criticized Trump's amiable disposition toward Saudi Arabia, but spoke positively of Trump's eff…

89.title: Trump's latest line of attack against 2020 Democrats is to tie them to socialism
89.description: President Donald Trump is trying to drum up fears about socialism as he seeks to discredit an expanding field of Democratic candidates for 2020. Trump has repeatedly pointed to the chaotic situation in Venezuela as a sign the US can't afford to turn to social…

90.title: Q&A WITH MATT DUSS: Bernie Sanders' foreign policy adviser breaks down the senator's progressive global agenda for 2020
90.description: Sen. Bernie Sanders is running for president again, and this time around he plans to be much more vocal about foreign policy. Matt Duss, Sanders' foreign policy adviser, spoke with INSIDER about the senator's global affairs priorities. Duss also addressed som…

98.description: Venezuela opposition leader Guaido says “all options open” to oust Maduro after he blocks aid The Globe and Mail Canada renews call to allow aid into Venezuela, stands ‘in solidarity’ with people Global News Venezuelans scramble for aid amid deadly clashes wi…
